result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Consecutive to: consecutive to 13cf1603 Racine case now being served.

superMiscConds.notes: COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. 
No illegally controlled substances

AODA, programs or treatment as recommended.
Random screening.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Reynolds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (30 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 24, 2015 received and filed. kl

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years - consecutive to 13cf1603 Racine case now being served -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening; 6) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Richard Reynolds in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Richard Reynolds in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Richard Reynolds not in court, in custody.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Pretrial conference.  Defendant in custody at Dodge Correctional; appearance waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.  Attorney Batt appears as new counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.

  Plea hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Richard Reynolds not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Batt needs to review discovery with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Wright moves to withdraw due to extended military leave.  Court allows Attorney Wright to withdraw subject to the public defender's office appoints new counsel.  Jury trial is cancelled.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Reynolds in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Richard Reynolds in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to adjourn the jury trial proceeds.  The State moves for an adjournment due to the unavailability of the district attorney and an essential witness.  Defense does not object.  State orally amends the witness list to add the lab analyst.  The Court will add her name to the list.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions and Instructions received and filed./ds
State's Motion to Adjourn Trial received and filed./ds
State's Witness List received and filed./ds

Defendant Richard Reynolds in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Richard Reynolds in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;des

Defendant would like a jury trial.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Edward Lee Wright in court, defendant Richard Reynolds not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Parties notified as of August 3, 2015, case will be assigned to Judge Konkol, branch 44, in room 316 of the safety building.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/3/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 44.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Reynolds in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Richard Reynolds in custody.  Brandon Wigley for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Ryan DeWitt-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Richard Reynolds in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Richard Reynolds in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard Reynolds
Current: 8810 W Silverspring Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 05-12-2015)
Prior: 2434 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
